radiographic_examinations.findings: Gallbladder appears under distended with multiple gallstones and no gallbladder wall thickening or pericholecystic fluid to suggest acute cholecystitis. Hepatic contours are unremarkable with no hepatic steatosis and no suspicious masses. There is no suspicious area of enhancement. Scattered millimetric hepatic cysts or hematomas. There is no pleural effusion. The common bile duct is of normal caliber as well as the intrahepatic biliary ducts. There is no choledocholithiasis. Unremarkable pancreatic signal with no pancreatic ductal dilatation. No splenomegaly. No hydronephrosis and no suspicious masses in kidneys. There is no bowel obstruction. Scattered colonic diverticulosis noted. There is no ascites. No retroperitoneal or mesenteric adenopathy. Abdominal aorta is of normal caliber with patent intra-abdominal branches. Unremarkable soft tissues and intact osseous structures.
